import React from "react"; import {Helmet} from "react-helmet"; class B54 extends React.Component { constructor(props) { super(props); this.state = { data: [], phone: "", }; } componentWillMount() { } render() { return (

What is a stock market?
What is a stock market?


You must have heard the terms NYSE, BSE, NSE a thousand times, sometimes making the headlines of newspapers sometimes of the news channels, but wouldn’t have passed you like nothing unless you have are or have been an active trader. So, let’s try to understand what is a stock market. It just like any other flea market or what we call in Hindi Bazaar in the world where there are different products being sold. Now exchange is like a medium which facilitates the buying and selling of different financial instruments. Here the instruments are bought and sold in the auction format to ensure the satisfaction of buyer and the seller. Nowadays these auctions are done for each and every stock every second or you may say every millisecond using computers and sophisticated software programmes. But this is not what a stock market is, it is rather a collection of exchanges that technically facilitates the buying, selling, issuance of shares of publicly-held companies. This is done with the formal exchanges or Over The Counter ( OTC) market places. These shares of publicly-held companies, are known as stocks or equities basically represent the fractional ownership of the company. The stock market is a place where such ownership can be bought and sold. So, there are two types of markets, primary and secondary. Primary where with the help of investment banks companies offer their Initial Public Offering (IPO), when the company first decides to become a publicly traded company by offering its stock shares. Once, these shares are sold in the primary market, they are traded in what are known as Secondary Markets . Here the shares are sold by the investor who has invested in it to the another who wants to invest in it at the prevailing market prices. Also, people interchangeably use stock market and exchange, but always remember that the stock exchange is merely the subset of the stock market. Stock Markets primarily ensure that the securities are traded For example you can trade stocks in India using BSE, NSE, MCX and various other stock exchanges which are regulated by a local regulatory body which in India is Security and Exchange Board of India (SEBI). The primary function of the stock market is to ensure that there is complete transparency and fair dealings in the transactions, there is sufficient liquidity, interests of investors are protected, prices are discovered efficiently .i.e. there is a range beyond which they don’t fall or rise, supports all the eligible types of participants and companies listed are monitored. All these measures are taken in place to support and promote more participation and fairness for them is maintained at all costs and all times. To know more about trading strategies click:{" "} Introduction to Trading

)}} export default B54;
